comments.raw_text: If you have your device blacklisted based on a downloaded blacklist, you might see "Blocked on your device - try updating your driver to x.y.z.w" in about:support. If you then update your driver, hardware acceleration will continue to be disabled on your computer until the blocklist service updates us with the blocklist again, and we can re-evaluate it.

comments.text:
Well if that is the case it is fine, because i have no idea how you update the graphics driver without rebooting.

If this decision is somehow cached, then perhaps when the blocklisting occurs, the prefernce for using acceleration should be set to false and setting it back to true could trigger a new blocklist evaluation.  That would seem to solve the problem here (if one really exists) in a manner that I think would make sense to the average user.

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> The blocklist service updates the blocklist daily yeah?
> So the newer driver will be detected in <24 hours; just not before?

Correct.

(In reply to comment #3)
> Joe: to be clear, if the user quits and restarts Firefox, certainly the
> blocklist gets evaluated again? We don't cache the blocklisting decision, do
> we?

We do cache the blocklist decision (in the gfx.blacklist.* prefs) and only re-evaluate when the blocklist service updates us.
